name: Keira Grant, M.S. (She/Her)
about:
As a servant leader I am passionate about helping others. I have best used my talents in education and workforce develop areas to help students succeed and achieve their academic and career goals. I have worked closely with faculty, staff, program coordinators, and directors to help students navigate the admissions process. I’ve worked to revamp and manage social media marketing strategies, and educational programs and initiatives, using various creative problem-solving models. Currently, I have the pleasure of working with our Say Yes Buffalo scholars as they learn to navigate our professional world. I am committed to providing professional and innovative experiences for students so they may achieve their goals. I believe our students are our the best investment!

My life has recently taken a beautiful turn into motherhood where I've welcomed twin girls. I have gained a new perspective and appreciation for life and new passion for black maternal advocacy.

In my free time, I enjoy hiking, traveling, wine tasting, and reading – What’s your latest read?

experiences.description:
It is my pleasure to help our Say Yes scholars navigate the professional world. In this role I am charged with helping out students find paid internship, established and excite their current career goals.

Activities and societies: Sidney Parnes & Ruth Noller Scholar
Activities and societies: Sidney Parnes & Ruth Noller Scholar
The Creative Studies program highlights creative thinking and problem solving as first outlined by Alex Osborn. In one of his most Novel works, Applied Imagination, Osborn reveals the importance of creative problem solving and how it can be woven into every facet of life. I have chosen this degree in hopes to make the education world a more creative place and to encourage students, instructors, and program directors to choose creativity in their program design and implementation.
